Stem: Stiff, erect, somewhat zig-zaggy and branched towards top.
Leaves: Single flat, narrow, ribbed, grass-like leaf 1m long.
Flowers: 6 petal-like segments. Orange to salmon pink with yellow star shaped centre.
FruitSeeds: Green maturing to brown 3-valved capsule up to 5 cm long, opening at top to release numerous small brown seeds.
Habitat: Coastal heathland, woodland, grassland, dry forest, wetlands.
DistinguishingFeatures: Has single leaf, compared to Two-leaf cape tulip (*Moraea miniata*) and Cape tulip (*Moraea ochroleuca*).
Impacts: All parts are toxic to stock, especially cattle. Displaces native ground vegetation.
